channel.title: Python on Ingots of learning
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Ingots of learning

item.title: Reworking the LabJack interface
item.description: To date, I have something that kind of approximates the beginning of the program I want to make. I can set a stream of data to start, but can’t stop it. I can live-plot this data, but without much control. I have yet to integrate in signal generation while streaming, which I’m pretty sure is possible, but am 100% sure is necessary. The biggest thing I’ve learned so far is that I need to integrate multi-threading.

item.title: Labjack experiments
item.description: My current job has me do a lot of random bits and pieces, very little coherent “This is your job” tasks. To date, I’ve created a website [LINK], studied Machine Learning, decided it was overkill for the image recognition program I then created, and helped to write a paper or two. Now, however, I am stepping well outside of my comfort area and attempting to modernize the interface between a computer and a two-decade old piece of lab equipment.
